word_mean: 抗体：一种具有特殊氨基酸序列的免疫球蛋白分子，由抗原诱导，在淋巴细胞系(尤指浆细胞)合成
它仅与此种抗原相互作用或与其密切相关的抗原起反应。抗体根据其作用方式进行分类，如凝集素、溶菌素、溶血素、调理素、沉淀素等。见immunoglobulin
机体内B细胞在抗原刺激下所产生的具特异性免疫功能的球蛋白。

sentence.Network_en: Scientists call this claw shape the antibody molecule's idiotype.
sentence.Network_cn: 科学家称这种爪型为抗体微小颗粒的遗传型.

sentence.Network_en: If the antibody reacted, the blood was tainted and should be discarded.
sentence.Network_cn: 如抗体发生反应, 则说明血液已被感染,便不能使用.

sentence.Network_en: It marshals the same antibody response to both of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 它对两者作出的抗体反应都是一样的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from anti- + body,translating German Antikörper, from anti- against + Körper 'body'

entry.def: Antibodies are substances which a person's or an animal's body produces in their blood in order to destroy substances which carry disease.

means.word_mean: 1. any of a large variety of proteins normally present in the body or produced in response to an antigen which it neutralizes, thus producing an immune response

auth_sentence.content: The antibody attaches to one of these proteins.

sentences.en: Antibodies in breast milk protect babies against infection.
sentences.cn: 母乳中所含的抗体可以保护婴儿免受感染。
